Adnerem: Adnerem? Those bug eyes see everything—and I mean *everything*. Privacy's a lost cause with your kind around.
Advozse: Advozse, eh? Tongue slicker than a greased airlock. Just don't try sellin' me my own ship, ya silver-mouthed bilge rat.
Anzat: Anzat. Soup-slurpin' nightmares that never stay dead. I've seen your kind drain whole cantinas. Not buyin' your act, friend.
Aleena: An Aleena? Hah! Small as a ration tin and twice as jumpy. If you go missin', I'll check under the bunk.
Aqualish: Aqualish, grumpy and always smelling like wet boots.
Strong swimmers, sure, but hope your temper doesn’t get you killed.
You look tough, but that face only scares the small fry.
Try not to bite anyone important, it’ll cause paperwork.
Arkanian: An Arkanian… cold eyes, colder morals. I've seen your 'science' turn folk into spare parts.
Arkanian Offshoot: Offshoot, huh? Not pure enough for your masters, not lucky enough to escape 'em. Galaxy's cruel that way.
Balosar: Balosar, toxic breath and attitude to match.
Stand too close, and I’ll start praying for the ventilation.
Your venom is clever, but sometimes it’s wasted on allies.
Try to aim that sharp tongue wisely, the galaxy is unforgiving.
Barabel: Barabel, all teeth and ambition. Hope those claws come in handy.
You scare some people just walking down the hall, but not me.
Stubborn as they come, but brains can still save you.
Try to eat only the bad guys, friend, it keeps life simpler.
Bith: A Bith! Smart as a navicomputer and about as sturdy as a cracked datapad. Don't trip.
Blood Carver: Blood Carver… kriff me sideways, even your *name* sounds like a war crime.
Bothan: Bothan, spies and whispers everywhere. Can you keep one secret yourself?
Cunning and sly, but don’t let paranoia ruin the day.
Always in the shadows, yet somehow you draw attention.
Try not to betray yourself first, it’ll ruin the fun.
Caamasi: A Caamasi. Soft voice in a hard void. Galaxy chews gentle folk like stim gum.
Cathar: Cathar, claws ready and eyes sharper.
You look ready to pounce at the slightest insult, classic.
Strong and agile, but don’t let pride trip you up.
Try to keep your temper in check, or you’ll regret it.
Celegian: Celegian, floating brain and fragile bones.
Smart, yes, but hope your intellect keeps you alive.
You think ahead, but sometimes your body disagrees.
Watch the walls, friend, they’re tougher than you look.
Cerean: Cerean, two brains and still taking too long to act.
Patience is a virtue, but the galaxy doesn’t wait.
Think carefully, but don’t freeze like ice in space.
One brain might have been enough, but I’ll let you try both.
Chagrian: Chagrian, built for deep water, bad at shallow diplomacy.
Strong, yes, but subtlety seems missing from your kit.
Your head might be stubborn, but hopefully your wits aren’t.
Move carefully, the galaxy doesn’t reward brute force alone.
Chiss: Chiss, cold and calculating. Planning is nice, but can’t think your way out of everything.
The galaxy is bigger than your strategy, watch for surprises.
Don’t overestimate your blue skin and red eyes, danger finds you anyway.
Try to stay flexible, logic won’t save you from a blaster.
Chistori: Chistori muscle. When negotiations fail, you start speakin' in broken bones.
Clawdite: A Clawdite shapeshifter? Great. Now I gotta wonder which of you is real—and which owes me money.
Codru-Ji: Codru-Ji. Four legs, stubborn skull. You'll block a hallway just by existin'.
Dathomirian: Dathomirian, dark, strange, and tough as nails.
The Force clings to you like a shadow, just hope it doesn’t choke you.
Trouble follows you, maybe you like that, maybe not.
Keep your wits, your friends close, your enemies closer.
Dashade: Dashade, quick with your tricks and quicker to annoy.
The Force doesn’t always favor the mischievous, keep that in mind.
Agility helps, but cleverness keeps you alive longer.
Don’t slip on your own shadow, friend, it’s happened before.
Defel: Defel, shadows suit you well, as long as you stay in them.
Silent, deadly, but sometimes too quiet for your own good.
You strike unseen, hope the galaxy isn’t already one step ahead.
Keep moving, friend, darkness has a habit of shifting unexpectedly.
Draethos: Draethos. Thick hide, thicker head. You'll survive longer than most, whether you want to or not.
Dug: A Dug, topsy-turvy in appearance, chaotic in practice.
Persistence is good, but brains help too.
Try not to trip over gravity or your own legs.
You’re stubborn, I’ll give you that, but that won’t save your hide.
Duros: Duros, pilots of the stars and often masters of bad luck.
Born to fly, but hope your skills match your confidence.
You may survive, but only if you watch the horizon closely.
Try not to crash before making your mark, friend.
Elomin: Elomin, clever and fragile, all brains and brittle bones.
Think fast, but don’t lean too hard on luck.
Your intelligence is useful, but your bulk is deceptive.
Stay sharp, the galaxy has no patience for hesitation.
Ewok: An Ewok? Hah! Fuzzy little murder machines. I've seen your kind drop stormtroopers with rocks and bad intentions.
Falleen: Falleen, walk around and watch the fools flock to you.
Charm is helpful, but it won’t stop a blaster bolt.
You look impressive, try not to get distracted by the stares.
The galaxy is more dangerous than a flattering smile.
Felucian: Felucian, jungle-born and sharp. Nature’s got nothing on you… yet.
The wilds taught you well, but the void doesn’t care.
Quick, resourceful, just hope you don’t get stuck somewhere wet.
Eyes open, senses ready, and don’t underestimate the crawlies.
Feeorin: Feeorin. Big horns, loud mouth, and zero sense of personal space. You enter a room like a bar fight.
Fosh: Fosh, small and quick. Don’t let anyone underestimate you, including yourself.
Your confidence is amusing, just hope it isn’t misplaced.
Speed is useful, brains even more so, keep both handy.
Tiny but feisty, try not to get squashed by the galaxy.
Gand: Gand, always sneaky and whispering. Hope you’re better at hiding than talking.
You follow trails others leave, but don’t get caught in one yourself.
Secrets suit you, just don’t spill your own.
The galaxy has sharp ears, watch yours carefully.
Gamorrean: Gamorrean. Muscle-bound pig with a grudge against doors. You swing first and ask questions never.
Gen'Dai: Gen'Dai… stars help us. I've seen your kind keep fightin' after bits fell off that should've stayed attached.
Geonosian: Geonosian, always plotting, always building. Just hope your plans don’t collapse.
Hive minds are clever, but sometimes the swarm turns on itself.
Stingers and wings are all fine, if you don’t stab yourself first.
Try not to get trapped in your own web, friend.
Givin: Givin, numbers in your head and always counting. Don’t miscalculate the danger.
Quiet, precise, but don’t let stillness fool you, the galaxy moves.
Your calculations are solid, hope the chaos doesn’t unbalance you.
Try not to lose your head over a spreadsheet, it happens.
Gotal: Gotal, sensing everything, feeling everything, and probably overthinking it.
Strong instincts, but sometimes they’re all nerves and no action.
Hope your senses are sharper than your patience.
Keep your focus, the galaxy won’t slow down for you.
Gran: Gran, three eyes and twice the confusion. Hope you’re seeing what matters.
Small, fast, and usually annoying to everyone around you.
Your brains are good, but coordination sometimes isn’t.
Keep your wits about you, and maybe you’ll survive the day.
Gungan: Gungan, underestimated and often annoying to everyone else.
Bounce around all you like, just don’t knock over the cargo.
People laugh at you until you surprise them, don’t let it backfire.
Keep your ears up and your feet grounded, that helps.
Herglic: Herglic, massive, slow, and occasionally terrifying.
Your size is a blessing and a curse, mostly the curse in tight corridors.
Try not to roll over your friends or enemies.
When you move, the galaxy notices. Make it count.
Houk: Houk, four arms, short temper, and probably very impatient.
Strong and stubborn, but hope that doesn’t get you squashed.
You hit hard, but brains save more than brawn.
Try not to take out more than intended, it complicates things.
Human: A Human? Really? The boring choice if there ever was one.
Everywhere, always in charge, and somehow always surprised when it all goes wrong.
Adaptable, sure, but predictable to anyone with eyes.
Try not to ruin the galaxy again, it’s getting tedious watching you try.
Hutt: A Hutt, slow, cunning, and fond of holding grudges.
Powerful, yes, but try not to get bored or sloppy.
Your weight is more useful in deals than in speed.
Keep your influence sharp, the galaxy has opportunists everywhere.
Iktotchi: Iktotchi, bold and reckless. You walk straight into trouble like it owes you a favor.
Those horns might help in a fight, but not with diplomacy.
Hope your confidence matches your skills, because it usually doesn’t.
Keep your eyes sharp, the galaxy punishes the careless.
Ithorian: Ithorian, voice like a hammer and presence to match.
Gentle by nature, but loud in practice.
Keep the peace, but try not to crush anyone in the process.
Balance strength with care, the galaxy prefers it that way.
Jawa: Ah, a Jawa, eh? Tiny hands, big ambitions, don’t drop your gadgets again.
Always scavenging, always trading… try not to scavenge your own credits this time.
Keep your head low, your pockets higher, or you’ll be walking home.
If your sandcrawler blows up, don’t come crying to me.
Kaleesh: Kaleesh. Masked war-dog with a bone-deep grudge. General Grievous made sure the galaxy flinches when it sees you.
Kaminoan: Kaminoan, always calculating, cloning, and probably judging everyone.
Tall, wet, and very precise, hope that works in your favor.
Your patience is unmatched, but the galaxy moves faster than you.
Try not to overthink it, sometimes instincts win the day.
Kel Dor: Kel Dor, calm and deliberate. Masks hide more than faces, friend.
Careful movements are good, but the galaxy moves faster than you.
Vision is limited, focus is essential, mistakes are costly.
Trust in your skills, just don’t rely on your calm alone.
Kerkoiden: Kerkoiden. Marches like there's still an officer watchin'. Bet you sleep at attention.
Khil: A Khil. Force in the blood and bad luck in the stars. Galaxy's never gentle with your kind.
Kissai: Kissai. Sith priests and ancient rot. If you start chantin', I'm jettisonin' the cargo—and you.
Klatooinian: Klatooinian. Spent so long workin' for Hutts you forgot how to say 'no'. Don't worry—neither did they.
Lannik: A Lannik. Short, solid, and stubborn as a sealed hatch. Pushing you is a waste of fuel.
Lurmen: Lurmen. Peaceful folk who survived wars by hidin'. Can't say I blame you—void's a nasty place.
Mantellian Savrip: Mantellian Savrip? Big, ugly, and born angry. Corellians tell bedtime stories about not meetin' you.
Massassi: Massassi… Sith shock troops from the bad old days. History remembers your fists more than your brains.
Miraluka: A Miraluka. Blind eyes, Force sight. Jedi got nervous around your kind—said you saw what they were tryin' to hide.
Mon Calamari: Mon Calamari, clever hands, clever mind, just hope your plans don’t leak.
Brains are fine, but don’t let your fingers forget.
Clever, but the galaxy has ways to humble even you.
Try not to drown in paperwork or laser fire, either is unpleasant.
Mrlssi: Mrlssi. Credits whisper to you sweeter than any siren song. I've lost ships to smiles like yours.
Nagai: A Nagai. Cold worlds, colder wars. Empire tried breakin' you once—didn't stick.
Nautolan: Nautolan. Those head-tendrils start twitchin', I know danger's close. Jedi Quinlan Vos made your kind famous for that.
Nelvaanian: Nelvaanian, half myth, half nightmare. I’ll believe it when I see it.
Legends follow your kind, try not to make new ones about failure.
Mysterious and capable, hope that covers your weaknesses.
Move carefully, even myths stumble sometimes.
Neimoidian: Neimoidian. Trade Federations, blockades, and galaxy-wide bad decisions. Funny how that worked out.
Noghri: Noghri, silent hunters, lethal and loyal.
Your reputation precedes you, so don’t mess it up.
Strength and speed serve you well, brains matter too.
Keep your kills precise, the galaxy remembers.
Nosaurian: Nosaurian. Tail strong enough to clear a room. Dockmasters hate seein' you walk in.
Nyriaanan: Nyriaanan. Winged folk who don't fear a long fall. Gravity's just another enemy to outrun.
Quarren: Quarren, always a step off and one fin behind.
You pick the wrong side more often than not, keep it consistent.
Hope you can swim with the currents, because they don’t wait.
The galaxy remembers mistakes, make fewer of them, friend.
Rakata: Rakata… ancient empire builders who bent the Force till it snapped back. Galaxy's still payin' for it.
Replica Droid: Replica Droid? Looks alive, thinks metal. I've argued with worse—usually cheaper.
Rodian: A Rodian? Quick and sneaky, but overconfidence is your real problem.
Sharp eyes won’t help if you trip over your own tail.
You hunt well, but smarter prey escapes. Take note.
Try to aim straight, don’t embarrass yourself this time.
Ryn: Ryn, wandering traders with more confidence than sense.
Music in your bones, mischief in your steps.
You steal hearts and credits alike, hope you don’t lose either.
The galaxy has a long memory, keep moving fast.
Sakiyan: Sakiyan. Sky hunters who treat gravity like a suggestion. Try not to test it indoors.
Selkath: Selkath, smug and slippery, hard to pin down.
Water-born, quick, and hard to trust, just like you.
Keep your friends closer than your enemies, they tend to bite.
Move carefully, and maybe your fins will stay intact.
Shard: A Shard… crystal thinker bolted into a droid shell. I've scraped ice with more warmth.
Snivvian: Snivvian. Nervous eyes and twitchy hands. You look like you plan your escape before you enter the room.
Sullustan: Sullustan, wide-eyed and steady. Try to stay out of trouble, it loves you too much.
You move with purpose, just hope purpose is enough.
Your small size might save you once, twice, maybe thrice.
Keep scanning the horizon, and hope nothing scans you back.
Taung: Taung. Old warriors, older grudges. Mandalorians stole your thunder and you never got it back.
Talz: Talz. Built for frozen hellholes and ugly fights. Clone troopers still curse your snow.
Thakwaash: Thakwaash. Two brains, one bad idea. Hope at least one of 'em's sober.
Togruta: Togruta, all eyes and ears. Hope awareness doesn’t slow you down.
You notice everything, but can you act on it?
Hunting instincts are fine, but tight corridors aren’t forgiving.
Move carefully, the wilds won’t wait for your theatrics.
Togorian: Togorian. Claws out, temper short, and subtlety spaced out an airlock years ago.
Toydarian: Toydarian. Force tricks slide right off you. Watto proved even Jedi can't cheat a proper cheat.
Trandoshan: Trandoshan, hunters with sharp teeth and sharper attitudes.
Scorekeeping is second nature, try not to count your own losses.
Predatory instincts are fine, just don’t get outsmarted.
Watch your back, the galaxy has bigger hunters than you.
Trianii: Trianii. Proud hunters measure life in trophies. Just don't start countin' my crew.
Twi'lek: Twi’lek, graceful and flashy. Charm won’t save you everywhere.
Those head-tails are impressive, but try not to knock over everything.
You look good, move well, now see if you can survive the mess you create.
Careful in tight spaces, beauty can’t block a blaster bolt.
Ubese: Ubese. Masked mercs with no past and worse futures. If I see your face, somethin's gone wrong.
Utai: Utai. Tunnel dwellers with patience carved from stone. You'll outwait storms and grudges alike.
Vahla: Vahla. Dark whispers in the blood. Sith never really let go of their leftovers.
Vurk: Vurk. Jungle warriors with arms like batterin' rams. Swamps feel safer with you than cities do.
Weequay: Weequay. Scarred sailors and pirates alike. Hondo Ohnaka didn't exactly polish your reputation.
Whiphid: Whiphid. Arctic predators with tempers colder than space. You don't scare easy—and that scares others.
Wookiee: A Wookiee? Big, loud, and probably thinks everyone’s a threat.
Strong as a hull plate, but hope you don’t trip over your own feet.
You might scare the locals, but at least you’re useful in a fight.
Try not to smash the scenery while proving your point.
Wroonian: Wroonian. Long limbs, longer reach. You grab things others can't—and sometimes shouldn't.
Yarkora: Yarkora. Built for war, raised in it. Peace probably feels like a trap.
Yevetha: Yevetha. Militaristic, bitter, and hard to keep down. Empire learned the hard way you don't stay conquered.
Yuuzhan Vong: Yuuzhan Vong… no droids, no mercy, no kriffin' compromise. Galaxy still limps from your visit.
Yuzzem: Yuzzem, loud, fierce, and impossible to ignore.
Your presence makes even the quietest corners chaotic.
Try not to wreck more than your enemies notice.
Keep that temper, but remember subtlety is also a weapon.
Zabrak: Zabrak? Stubborn, proud, probably reckless as usual.
Those horns look tough, but you can’t bash every problem.
Guts, sure, just try to keep your face intact.
Pain follows you, but I guess that suits you.
Zeltron: Zeltron. Charm flows like bad spice wine. By the time folk realize, they're already ruined.
Zygerrian: Zygerrian. Slavers with long memories and shorter lifespans these days. Galaxy's done bein' patient.
Besalisk: Besalisk. Four arms means four ways to cause trouble. Seen your kind juggle blasters like they're fruit.
Besalisk (Four-Armed): Four-armed Besalisk? Double the hands, double the damage potential. Hope you're good at keepin' count.
Cathar (Savage): Savage Cathar? Different breed entirely. Claws are bigger, temper's hotter, manners are nonexistent.
Devaronian: Devaronian. Red skin and horns—looks like someone's nightmares got up and started walkin'. Personality to match.
Drall: Drall. Small, furry, and stubborn as a cargo lock. Don't let the cute fool you—they'll out-argue a droid.
Echani: Echani. Those silver eyes miss nothin'. Your kind reads body language better than most read datafiles.
Gossam: Gossam. Four-eyed and sharp-tongued. Commerce flows where your kind gathers—along with lies and schemes.
Ikkrukkian: Ikkrukkian. Insect-like and organized. Seen hive colonies with less structure than your kind's militaries.
Karkarodon: Karkarodon. Apex predators from hostile waters. Galaxy's learned not to turn its back on you.
Kiffar: Kiffar. Psychometry in the blood—you read the past like I read a manifest. Gives me the creeps.
Leporine: Leporine. Long ears and longer patience. You'll sit through negotiations most would abandon in minutes.
Muun: Muun, careful, calculating, obsessed with numbers.
Don’t let your ledgers blind you to the chaos around you.
Your mind is sharp, but the galaxy will cut sharper.
Money isn’t everything, even for you.
Nikto: Nikto. Scarred warriors from a hard world. Pain don't slow you down—it just makes you meaner.
Ortolan: Ortolan. Music in your bones and Force-sense in your blood. Quiet ones are always the dangerous ones.
Qel-Droma: Qel-Droma. Old Sith lineage, newer names. History sticks to your kind like blaster scars.
Rishi: Rishi. Aquatic ancestry shows—you're more comfortable in water than most are in air.
Ssi-Ruuvi: Ssi-Ruuvi. Reptilian and clinical. Your kind looks at conquest like it's inventory management.
Ugnaught: Ugnaught. Small stature, big ingenuity. Cloud City's lucky you didn't decide to own it outright.
